chunk: Fruity porridge recipe A deliciously creamy warm breakfast with added fruit. If you're making this for children over 5 years, simply swap to lower-fat milks and yoghurts. Age: 10 to 12 months Prep: 5 mins Cook: 5 mins Portions: 1 Ingredients - 2 tbsp (20g) porridge oats - 120ml full-fat milk - 1/4 medium banana - 10g frozen berries - 1tsp plain full-fat yoghurt Method Put the porridge oats and milk into a saucepan. Heat up, stirring constantly, until the porridge thickens. Then reduce the heat and simmer gently for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring until the oats are cooked. Slice the banana into finger-sized sticks. Add a little more milk if your baby prefers it a little runnier. Pour the porridge into a bowl, add the yogurt and serve with the banana sticks. Stir the blueberries into the porridge and heat through until completely soft. Weaning tip Try giving
title: Fruity Porridge
description: A deliciously creamy warm breakfast with added fruit. If you're making this for children over 5 years, simply swap to lower-fat milks and yoghurts.

chunk: the porridge into a bowl, add the yogurt and serve with the banana sticks. Stir the blueberries into the porridge and heat through until completely soft. Weaning tip Try giving your baby a spoon so they can practice feeding themselves. It's messy so use a bib and a messy mat for easier cleaning!
